comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: September 9, 1913destroyed by an exploding engine on October 17, 1913 during a test flight; the entire crew was killed. This photo was with the L2 name, but due to name changing schemes, it is also known as LZ 18 wkikpedia shows a historical card of it going down, labeled as L2 just like here en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Crash_Zeppelin_LZ18_(LII).jpg

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The NYT of Oct 18, 1913 reported on the explosion of L-II the day before query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9807EFDC133FE633A...

comment.author: 34997905@N03
comment._content: Thanks, Wystan. Does seem that the proper spelling should appear somewhere in the record so that it might come up on a search for Zeppelins.
